venice.hub

Class VeniceControl

  • java.lang.Object
    • venice.hub.VeniceControl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConsoleControl, RPCControl

    public abstract class VeniceControl
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Control classes are the user interfaces to VeniceHub. They receive user commands and forward them to VeniceHub, by calling the appropriate method.

    Example methods from VeniceHub:

    • setPause(boolean pause)
    • switchPause()
    • quit()
    • seekForRelativePosition(long relativeTimestamp)
    • seekForTimestamp(long seekTime)
    • reset()
    There are more methods, look for the public static methods in VeniceHub.

    This should be used as a thread. Stop it by calling stopThread().

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished()
        Returns true if this Thread can be safely killed.

        After the call of stopThread this Thread will try to get into a safe closing state.

        Returns:
        true if it is safe to kill this thread
